name: Radio Silence
description: In a far-flung part of the Alpha Quadrant, a strange sound has incapacitated the crews of multiple ships. But the sound and its source are a complete mystery. Solve the mystery before a vital piece of the galaxy goes silent for good.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Supply Missions in one phase, and Faction Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Supply Missions and Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Ogawa, Cutler, Uhura or Xenoanthropologists will provide a bonus to Supply Missions and Faction Missions.
-- Every Supply or Faction Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 1 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Ogawa, Cutler, Uhura or Xenoanthropologists
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Q
featured_crew.flavor: Q takes Janeway to the Q Continuum recreating the American Civil War to try and explain to her why the Continuum is at war with itself.

featured_crew.name: Cutler
featured_crew.flavor: An entomologist, Cutler's expertise was in high demand on the surface of the planet that would become Archer IV.

action.name: Thanks For Choosing Me For This Mission

featured_crew.name: Uhura
featured_crew.flavor: Commander Uhura served under Captain Spock during the attempted theft of the Genesis Device.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.flavor: Q takes Janeway to the Q Continuum recreating the American Civil War to try and explain to her why the Continuum is at war with itself.

adventures.name: Better, Faster
adventures.description: Upgrade ship equipment to avoid damage from the waves.

adventures.name: Golden Oldies
adventures.description: Collect and compare samples to other sound waves.

adventures.name: Technologic
adventures.description: Assess impacts of the waves on starship equipment.

adventures.name: Unchained Melody
adventures.description: Determine the cause of the aural disturbance.

rewards.name: Radio Silence
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Technologic
adventures.description: Assess impacts of the waves on starship equipment.

adventures.name: Head Games
adventures.description: Analyze neural data of impacted crew members.

adventures.name: Heart and Soul
adventures.description: Locate the source of the sound.

adventures.name: Unchained Melody
adventures.description: Determine the cause of the aural disturbance.

rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Uhura
rewards.flavor: Commander Uhura served under Captain Spock during the attempted theft of the Genesis Device.

rewards.name: Cutler
rewards.flavor: An entomologist, Cutler's expertise was in high demand on the surface of the planet that would become Archer IV.

action.name: Thanks For Choosing Me For This Mission

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Reach a diplomatic solution with the Federation.
Find an advanced solution with the Augments.
Use the Borg's collective knowledge to find an answer.

screens.text: "I realize it's probably unusual getting a distress call out here, but our situation is desperate - and strange. We were dispatched to assist crews that have been incapacitated."
"An unfamiliar sound echoed throughout the ship and immediately after, the computers began to malfunction and, frankly, so did the crew members' bodies. We've stabilized them, but..."
"...but who knows how long until the same happens to us. We've analyzed the sound - or tried. It's just as destructive as Ogawa says. I'm hesitant to even move the rescue crew at this point."
"Which is where you come in, Captain. I've heard good things about you from Starfleet and it's time to show us what you've got. Find out what this sound is and how to deal with it."
"I realize it's probably unusual getting a distress call out here, but our situation is desperate - and strange. We were dispatched to assist crews that have been incapacitated."
"An unfamiliar sound echoed throughout the ship and immediately after, the computers began to malfunction and, frankly, so did the crew members' bodies. We've stabilized them, but..."
"...but who knows how long until the same happens to us. We've analyzed the sound - or tried. It's just as destructive as Ogawa says. I'm hesitant to even move the rescue crew at this point."
"Which is where you come in, Captain. I've heard good things about you from Starfleet and it's time to show us what you've got. Find out what this sound is and how to deal with it."

"Good work, Captain. Though I don't believe I've seen anything like this in all my years as a communications officer. If your research is correct, these sound waves are either sentient themselves or housing some sort of lifeform. Unbelievable."

"The Commander is right. Somehow, these soundwaves are sentient, but their "habitat" is no longer sustainable, due to the drift in interstellar matter. It seems they've been forced to take on a parasitic existence, luring in ships and crews to forge intermediaries to relay them."

responses.text: "It's our responsibility to prevent the extinction of this species."
"We could learn a lot from this species and how they live and migrate."
"We can't risk the safety of our crews any further."

screens.text: "But the fact still stands that their method of survival is harmful to organic lifeforms and technology alike. I know we have to be cognizant of other lifeforms, but we have a duty to our fellow crew members as well. What do you think, Captain?"

"I agree that we cannot leave this species to languish in the void of space. But they're more than our crew or our ship can handle. Still, in their own way, they sent us a distress signal. We can't just ignore them."

"We could. The way they travel, their ingenuity in navigating interstellar matter, their very existence. It's all completely fascinating. But the idea of diving that deep with a species so fragile it's on the verge of extinction, and yet so volatile, it puts our crew at risk..."
"I have to agree. I'm not unsympathetic to this species, as everyone keeps calling it. We doctors and nurses seek to save lives. But their parasitic existence is putting our crew at risk."
"It's not an easy matter to solve. However, I believe you'll make the right choice, Captain. We're counting on you."

"Good work, Captain. Though I don't believe I've seen anything like this in all my years as a communications officer. If your research is correct, these sound waves are either sentient themselves or housing some sort of lifeform. Unbelievable."

"The Commander is right. Somehow, these soundwaves are sentient, but their "habitat" is no longer sustainable, due to the drift in interstellar matter. It seems they've been forced to take on a parasitic existence, luring in ships and crews to forge intermediaries to relay them."

"We can't risk the safety of our crews any further."

"I agree that we cannot leave this species to languish in the void of space. But they're more than our crew or our ship can handle. Still, in their own way, they sent us a distress signal. We can't just ignore them."

"We could. The way they travel, their ingenuity in navigating interstellar matter, their very existence. It's all completely fascinating. But the idea of diving that deep with a species so fragile it's on the verge of extinction, and yet so volatile, it puts our crew at risk..."
"I have to agree. I'm not unsympathetic to this species, as everyone keeps calling it. We doctors and nurses seek to save lives. But their parasitic existence is putting our crew at risk."
"It's not an easy matter to solve. However, I believe you'll make the right choice, Captain. We're counting on you."
